name: HAARP [Heavy Anti-Authoritarian Rap Poems]
description:
"The book's title unapologetically flat-out warns the reader that to unseal it is to be met with a rap-class cannon booming within its pages. 

A read of HAARP is like awaiting a heard of buffalo to pass. As an early Plains explorer wrote- it's "a day's-walk wide and a 3-days' wait long." Only now, in these 172 pages, a reader is going to be in the midst of the tumult of those great thundering beasts- now transformed into the author's voice to carry the reader on che's thoughts, bellowed- rarely subtle, rock-hard lyrical punches to the brain."

book review by journalist Jim Olson, 2012

name: Standing Silent Nation DVD
description: This compelling documentary chronicles the story of a Native American family as they assert their sovereignty through the growing of industrial hemp, in order to create economic independence. Link text

name: Standing Silent Nation DVD Educational
description: This compelling documentary chronicles the story of a Native American family as they assert their sovereignty through the growing of industrial hemp, in order to create economic independence. Link text For libraries, schools, and institutions. Screening and discussion guides along with curriculum are available.

name: Tampico-a documentary short
description:
“When I was five my mother said, if you want to eat you have to learn how to whistle.”

	“Tampico” is a documentary short about a woman’s struggle to support herself and her 50-year old mentally challenged brother by playing their family’s traditional music in the subways of Chicago.

	Set within the backdrop of a rapidly disappearing neighborhood, Tampico makes hard choices in order to protect her family.

	Directed by Suree Towfighnia, 2006
